@Mavcarter asked what I would like to see changed? I want the money that comes in from the #NCAA invested more in the #StudentAthletes. Some of these individuals come from disadvantaged communities, & it is unfortunate the students and their families are forced to struggle.
Great conversation tonight at the After the Final Buzzer Panel Discussion on Capitol Hill. pic.twitter.com/hlAtgNMwiR

@mavcarter asked the #StudentAthlete panel: Players struggle with painful injuries that result from college sports, and struggle with paying for healthcare for career ending injuries. What is the impact of long-term sports injuries, and are we making the risk worth the reward?

Natasha Cloud: We (female athletes)  still drive the revenue. The NCAA is still making money on the women's tournament. But in terms of marketing and access, the women's tournament doesn't get as much advertisment as the men's tournament. #StudentAthlete
We are live-streaming tonight's #StudentAthlete panel at  https://www.facebook.com/RepAlLawsonJr . Join the conversation.
@SteveStoute: I wanted to make this movie to highlight the treatment of #StudentAthletes -- the free labor and money being made off the backs of students.
@mavcarter asks the former athletes on the panel on their experiences as an #StudentAthlete
